title: RECIPROCATING PUMPS AND CLOSURES THEREFORE
abstract: A closure for the fluid end of a reciprocating pump which uses a closure plate or assembly that is secured in a slot formed in the fluid end body so that no retaining threads must be formed in the body.

motivations: Conventional reciprocating pumps have limitations due to the need for retaining threads in the fluid end body to secure the closure.
objectives: Design a closure for the fluid end of a reciprocating pump that eliminates the need for retaining threads in the body.
methods: Utilize a closure plate or assembly secured in a slot formed in the fluid end body.
results: Simplify the design and potentially improve the reliability of reciprocating pumps by eliminating the need for retaining threads.

motivations: Traditional reciprocating pumps require retaining threads to be formed in the body, which can be a complex process.
objectives: Develop a closure for the fluid end of a reciprocating pump that eliminates the need for retaining threads in the body.
methods: Design a closure plate or assembly that can be secured in a slot formed in the fluid end body of the pump.
results: Simplify the assembly process of reciprocating pumps by eliminating the need for retaining threads in the body.

motivations: Traditional reciprocating pump closures require retaining threads to be formed in the fluid end body, which can complicate manufacturing and maintenance.
objectives: Develop a closure system for reciprocating pumps that eliminates the need for retaining threads in the fluid end body.
methods: Design a closure plate or assembly that can be secured in a slot formed in the fluid end body.
results: Simplified pump closure design that reduces manufacturing complexity and potentially improves maintenance efficiency.
anthropic_json.research_subject: Thread-free closure system for reciprocating pump fluid ends
